Package personal.gym.registration

Class ListRegistrations

java.lang.Object
personal.gym.registration.ListRegistrations
public class ListRegistrations
extends java.lang.Object
Data structure holding the list of currently valid registrations for which members have not yet attended the registered session.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Yu Deng, Philippe Gabriel, Julien Thibeault, Yan Zhuang

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ListRegistrations​(java.util.List<Registration> registrations)
    Initializes the list of registrations.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void clear()
    Clears the registrations list from its contents.
    boolean confirmRegistration​(java.lang.String memberNo, java.lang.String sessionNo, java.lang.String comment)
    Confirms a member's registration to a session and generates a validation which indicates that the member has attended the session if the registration is valid.
    java.util.List<Registration> consultRegistrations​(java.lang.String sessionNo)
    Retrieves the registrations for a particular session.
    Registration createRegistration​(java.lang.String sessionNo, java.lang.String memberNo, java.lang.String profNo, java.lang.String comment)
    Creates a new registration for a session taught by a professional for a member and adds it unto the list of registrations.

    Retrieves an existing registration for a given session by a given member or null if absent.

  • Method Details

    • setListValidations

      public void setListValidations​(ListValidations listValidations)
      Parameters:
      listValidations - ListValidations reference

    • getRegistrations

      public java.util.List<Registration> getRegistrations()
      Returns:
      List of registrations

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the registrations list from its contents. This method should be called on a weekly basis.

    • createRegistration

      public Registration createRegistration​(java.lang.String sessionNo, java.lang.String memberNo, java.lang.String profNo, java.lang.String comment) throws InvalidFormatException, java.text.ParseException
      Creates a new registration for a session taught by a professional for a member and adds it unto the list of registrations.
      Parameters:
      sessionNo - Session number
      memberNo - Member number
      profNo - Professional number
      comment - Registration comment
      Returns:
      Newly created registration
      Throws:
      InvalidFormatException - if at least one of the provided fields does not respect the imposed format
      java.text.ParseException - if a parse error occurs

    • getMemberRegistration

      public Registration getMemberRegistration​(java.lang.String memberNo, java.lang.String sessionNo)
      Retrieves an existing registration for a given session by a given member or null if absent.
      Parameters:
      memberNo - Member number
      sessionNo - Session number
      Returns:
      Appropriate registration or null if absent

    • removeRegistrationsProf

      public void removeRegistrationsProf​(java.lang.String profNo)
      Removes the registrations for sessions under a given professional.
      Parameters:
      profNo - Professional number

    • removeRegistrationsMember

      public void removeRegistrationsMember​(java.lang.String memberNo)
      Removes the registrations under a member.
      Parameters:
      memberNo - Member number

    • consultRegistrations

      public java.util.List<Registration> consultRegistrations​(java.lang.String sessionNo)
      Retrieves the registrations for a particular session.
      Parameters:
      sessionNo - Session number
      Returns:
      List of registrations for the session

    • confirmRegistration

      public boolean confirmRegistration​(java.lang.String memberNo, java.lang.String sessionNo, java.lang.String comment) throws java.text.ParseException, InvalidFormatException
      Confirms a member's registration to a session and generates a validation which indicates that the member has attended the session if the registration is valid.
      Parameters:
      memberNo - Member number
      sessionNo - Session number
      comment - Validation comment
      Returns:
      true if the registration is valid and thus a validation has been created, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.text.ParseException - if parsing error occurs
      InvalidFormatException - if any of the provided attributes does not respect the imposed format
